subject: Investing
title: Credit Risk and Default
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Credit Risk and Default.

hook.text: You lent money to a company. It goes bankrupt. Your bond is now worth 40 cents on the dollar. Welcome to credit risk.

buildup.text: Credit risk is the chance that a bond issuer fails to make interest payments or repay the principal.

discovery.text: Rating agencies like Moody's and S&P grade bonds from AAA (safest) to D (in default). Ratings drive pricing.

twist.text: Before 2008, agencies rated mortgage bonds AAA. They defaulted anyway. Ratings are opinions, not guarantees.

climax.text: Recovery rates vary. Senior bondholders typically recover 40 to 60 cents per dollar. Junior bondholders get less.

punchline.text: Credit risk is the price of yield. Higher interest always means higher doubt.

quiz.question: What do bond credit ratings from agencies like Moody's indicate?
options: The likelihood the issuer will repay its debt
How much interest the bond pays
